title: How to Minimize All Open Windows Without Having a Windows Button

steps.title: Hover your cursor over the right corner of the taskbar.
steps.content: Hover your cursor over the right corner of the taskbar. In recent versions of Windows, there is a rectangular button on the right side of the taskbar that is hidden until you place your cursor on it. Once your cursor is over the farthest-right edge of the taskbar (past the time and date), a vertical line will appear.

steps.title: Click the vertical line.
steps.content: Click the vertical line. This instantly minimizes all open Windows, showing you your entire desktop.

steps.title: Bring all your windows back.
steps.content: Bring all your windows back. To maximize the previously minimized windows, click the vertical line again.

steps.title: Right-click the taskbar.
steps.content: Right-click the taskbar. The taskbar , normally at the bottom of the screen, is where you'll find your Start menu and open programs. Right-clicking it should show a small window with options.

steps.title: Click Show the desktop.
steps.content: Click Show the desktop . This minimizes all open windows.

steps.title: Right-click again and select Show open windows.
steps.content: Right-click again and select Show open windows . This brings your windows back into view.

steps.title: Click on an open window you want to minimize.
steps.content: Click on an open window you want to minimize. Though you can't use a keyboard shortcut to instantly minimize all open Windows without a Windows key , you can use your keyboard to minimize each window individually.

steps.title: Use Alt+Spacebar+N to minimize.
steps.content: Use Alt + Spacebar + N to minimize. Pressing Alt + Spacebar + N at the same time instantly minimizes the current window and brings your focus to the next window.

steps.title: Click another window to select it.
steps.content: Click another window to select it. If the next window you want to minimize isn't already in the foreground, click the next window you want to minimize.

steps.title: Press Alt+Spacebar+N again until all windows are minimized.
steps.content: Press Alt + Spacebar + N again until all windows are minimized. Continue using this shortcut until you can see your entire desktop without open windows.

steps.title: Bring back a minimized window with Alt+Tab ↹.
steps.content: Bring back a minimized window with Alt + Tab ↹ . To restore a window you've minimized, press and hold Alt + Tab to view all open windows . You can then continue holding Alt while lifting your finger from the Tab key, and then press Tab repeatedly until you've highlighted the window you want to reopen. When you release both fingers, the window will reappear. The command Alt + Tab ↹ only works for minimizing/maximizing one window at a time.
